name: Scribe Rothchild
descriptions: Reginald Rothchild is the senior scribe of the Brotherhood of Steel in 2277.
Scribe Rothchild is in charge of the scribes of the Brotherhood of Steel in the Capital Wasteland,
Despite that, Rothchild was a part of Star Paladin Owyn Lyons' expedition to Washington, D.C. in 2255.

Success proved elusive in his own project as well. Despite intense efforts, Rothchild and the rest of his team failed to reactivate Liberty Prime for over twenty years. As he worked on Liberty Prime, he observed the steady deterioration of the chapter under Lyons' leadership and the changes introduced to their mission.
Especially after Lyons' insubordination led to the West cutting the D.C. bunker loose, denying them reinforcements and shutting off communications,

In this situation, the conflict with the Enclave seemed like a death knell for the chapter. However, with the arrival of Madison Li, Rothchild decided to continue his work in a last-ditch attempt at reactivating Liberty Prime.

When the Enclave finally managed to destroy Liberty Prime by luring him to their satellite relay station in Rockland, Rothchild was heartbroken. The loss set the chapter back years and removed their only significant advantage over the Enclave, which remained a potent threat even with the loss of the purifier and Raven Rock.

After the fall of Adams AFB, Rothchild returned to his roots, starting work on rebuilding Liberty Prime. Although the task was daunting, requiring immense amounts of salvage to restore its complex systems, especially electrical components and optics, he rose to the challenge.
He can usually be found in the Citadel laboratory.
Reginald Rothchild appears in Fallout 3, its add-on Broken Steel, Fallout Shelter, Fallout Shelter Online, and Fallout: Wasteland Warfare.

topics.topic_text: How long have you been here?
topics.response_text: We arrived here in '55. Established ourselves in the Citadel within the first few months. The Elder has kept us busy since then.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about the Brotherhood of Steel.
topics.response_text: I'm afraid you're asking the wrong person.

topics.topic_text: Why is that a sore subject?
topics.response_text: Much has happened in the 23 years since we left the west coast. Our mission has changed in that time.

topics.topic_text: It must be difficult to communicate with the West Coast.
topics.response_text: Indeed it is. Especially when they refuse any attempts at communication.{wry}

topics.topic_text: Sorry. Never mind.
topics.response_text: No need to apologize.

topics.topic_text: Sorry to have brought it up.
topics.response_text: You are an outsider. You had no way of knowing.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to hear what you have to say anyway.
topics.response_text: If you insist. What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: What kind of changes?
topics.response_text: We were dispatched with a specific mission. We were sent to locate and secure any technology remaining from before the war.

topics.topic_text: Why are you the wrong person to ask?
topics.response_text: Predominantly because the Elder won't like some of what I have to say.{wry}

topics.topic_text: Why are you here in the Capital Wasteland?
topics.response_text: Well, that all depends on who you ask.{wry}

topics.topic_text: That's all I wanted to know.
topics.response_text: Was there something else, then?

topics.topic: BosRestofBoSIf you're just a part of the Brotherhood, where's the rest of it?
topics.topic_text: You seem to have a pretty small organization.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood of Steel is bigger than what you see here. We're only a small... division, you could say.{wry}

topics.topic_text: Then where's the rest of the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: The West Coast, unless something has changed.

topics.topic_text: Those sound like pretty good changes to me.
topics.response_text: You're an outsider. I don't expect you to understand.

topics.topic_text: Why, what happened?
topics.response_text: Lines of communication were severed years ago. The Western Elders have washed their hands of us.

topics.topic_text: He's in charge, so it's his decision, right?
topics.response_text: He's in charge of this detachment, yes. He's not in charge of the Brotherhood.

topics.topic_text: You make saving people sound like a bad thing.
topics.response_text: It wasn't why we were sent here. Good or bad has nothing to do with it.

topics.topic_text: What do you mean by "repercussions"?
topics.response_text: Some did not approve of the Elder's decisions. Initially, they followed because we are all taught to follow the Elders.

topics.topic_text: Well, I'm asking you. Why are you here?
topics.response_text: I'm here for two reasons. One, Lyons needs me. He always has, just as much as I need him. We've been through a lot together, he and I.

topics.topic_text: But not everyone agrees?
topics.response_text: No, not everyone. But for a variety of reasons, those who disagree are no longer with us.

topics.topic_text: That's all I needed.
topics.response_text: Very well.

topics.topic_text: I've learned a little bit, but was hoping you could tell me more.
topics.response_text: Yes, I believe I can. Step over here for a moment, will you?

topics.topic_text: He said you'd give me the details.
topics.response_text: Well, Owyn does have quite a bit on his mind lately, as I'm sure you can imagine.

topics.topic_text: All I know is that you need my help. Again.
topics.response_text: It would seem that way, yes.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry about the robot. There wasn't anything anyone could've done.
topics.response_text: Perhaps not, but that doesn't change the fact that it sets us back years... YEARS...

topics.topic_text: It could've been worse. They could have attacked the Citadel.
topics.response_text: Well, there's certainly nothing stopping them from doing that now, is there?

topics.topic_text: Hopefully I found something that can help you.
topics.response_text: I don't know what could help at this point. If anything, we should be thankful they waited this long to use... whatever they used.

topics.topic_text: I found some encrypted data at the relay station.
topics.response_text: Ah, yes. Well, I'll see if we can't figure out how to read it. Perhaps it can give us some insight as to just what happened out there.

topics.topic_text: I'm not sure what I found. Some kind of data... Maybe you can figure it out.
topics.response_text: Yes, well... We'll do our best. It won't be the first time we've had to crack one of their codes.

topics.topic_text: Maybe you can focus on analyzing this data instead of crying about your robot.
topics.response_text: Well, I...{offended}

topics.topic_text: How is Liberty Prime holding up?
topics.response_text: Performance is exceeding all our expectations.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything else I can do to help the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: Yes, yes please. Your help would be most welcome.

topics.topic_text: So, what happens to the Brotherhood now?
topics.response_text: I've been amazingly busy ever since we began clashing with the Enclave. All their technology is amazing.

topics.topic_text: I have Cameras for you, Scribe Rothchild.
topics.response_text: Good, good. Please keep bringing them to me... it's my only hope of getting Prime's optics rebuilt.

topics.topic_text: So, have we totally wiped out the Enclave?
topics.response_text: From the amount of equipment pouring in, I'd say if we didn't destroy them, we certainly threw a major wrench into their works.

topics.topic_text: How's the reconstruction of Liberty Prime going?
topics.response_text: We have so much to do putting him back together again. I'm uncertain as to how long it might take. Months? Years?

topics.topic_text: I found some Sensor Modules for you.
topics.response_text: Ah, very nice. I'll have my assembling team get right on it.

topics.topic_text: What's going on with the purifier?
topics.response_text: It was determined that the Brotherhood should directly oversee the purifier, so as to prevent any mishaps.

topics.topic_text: DLC03TransitionTopic
topics.response_text: Owyn, why do you keep torturing yourself? Coming down here isn't going to help at all. We have enough to deal with already.

topics.topic_text: Can someone in the Citadel train me to wear Power Armor?
topics.response_text: Hmph. Typical. Surrounded by the keenest scientific minds in the Capital Wasteland, but do you thirst for our knowledge, our experience? No.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I'm sure you'll understand that there's far too much to be done right now. I've no time for chatting.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, yeah. Whatever. Are you going to help or not?
topics.response_text: Taking the loss in stride, are we?{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Thanks for your sympathy.
topics.response_text: Think nothing of it.

topics.topic_text: Thanks for your help.
topics.response_text: I wish we could do more, but the Brotherhood potentially faces a very pressing, very real threat in the Enclave.

topics.topic_text: Great. Thanks for nothing.
topics.response_text: I find it hard to believe your father raised such a child.

topics.topic_text: I can handle it.
topics.response_text: Can you now, without even knowing what the problem is?

topics.topic_text: It's about damn time.
topics.response_text: Indeed. Farewell.{annoyed, dismissive.}

topics.topic_text: There's got to be another way.
topics.response_text: You share your father's determination, it seems. And in this case, you are correct. There may well be another way.{bemused}

topics.topic_text: Don't you know?
topics.response_text: No, I'm afraid not. After initial attempts to cross the radiation failed, it was decided to focus our efforts elsewhere.

topics.topic_text: Well, I guess it's time to find out. I'll go there myself.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood simply cannot spare the resources necessary to investigate the area. Perhaps you may be more successful.

topics.topic_text: So there's a Vault down there, and you've never bothered investigating it?
topics.response_text: Attempts were made, but our resources are stretched thin. The radiation proved fatal, and so our efforts were focused elsewhere.

topics.topic_text: I'm running short on time, here. Let's cut to the chase.
topics.response_text: Yes, well... I am afraid that with the emergence of the Enclave, the Brotherhood is rather busy right now.

topics.topic_text: How did you know my father?
topics.response_text: I have been a part of the Brotherhood for many years. Enough that I was here when Project Purity first began.

topics.topic_text: I need to find a G.E.C.K.
topics.response_text: Are you quite sure? I suspect that would be a waste of time. Regardless, the Brotherhood is not in possession of such a device.

topics.topic_text: I need to find Vault 87 right now.
topics.response_text: I take it you were successful, then.{mildly annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Vault 87 has a G.E.C.K., but I don't know where it is.
topics.response_text: Ah. Well, that much I believe I can help with.

topics.topic_text: My father was looking for something called a G.E.C.K. Do you have one?
topics.response_text: A G.E.C.K.? Goodness, no. Certainly not.

topics.topic_text: Geez, don't strain yourself on my account... I just need a G.E.C.K.
topics.response_text: I fail to see how such a device would be useful to you. In fact, I doubt such a thing really works.

topics.topic_text: So that's it? I'm screwed?
topics.response_text: So quick to give up... Disappointing.

topics.topic_text: So you know how to find one?
topics.response_text: Possibly. I'm afraid I won't be able to assist you directly; the news Doctor Li has brought will require me to be elsewhere.

topics.topic_text: Where was Vault 87 again?
topics.response_text: Check the map in the lab for reference, if you like. The Vault is to the west of the city, far out in the Capital Wasteland.

topics.topic_text: Thanks for the help.
topics.response_text: You are welcome. If you require further assistance, I may be able to help.

topics.topic_text: How do I get through the radiation?
topics.response_text: Quite simply, you don't. To attempt such a thing would be certain death for you.

topics.topic_text: Fine, whatever. Let's get to it.
topics.response_text: I find your attitude and lack of respect insulting.

topics.topic_text: Why, what's difficult about it?
topics.response_text: The area is highly irradiated; lethal levels are all around the entrance. Gaining direct access will be quite impossible.

topics.topic_text: Care to share anything about the Super Mutants?
topics.response_text: Not really, no.

topics.topic_text: Are you in charge of the um... the robot?
topics.response_text: I am, and have been since we first found him, well over twenty years ago.

topics.topic_text: Who built Liberty Prime? Or better yet... why?
topics.response_text: He was developed as a super weapon, back in the days before the war. The first joint operation between RobCo and General Atomics International.

topics.topic_text: Do you think you could repair my equipment?
topics.response_text: Could I? Yes. Will I? No. Go see Peabody or Bowditch.

conversation.response_text: What is it, Owyn? This robot isn't going to fix itself.
We've been over this. A slight modification to one system... and all the subroutines go haywire. Don't worry. I'm on it.
All right, all right. I'll see what what I can do.
Now, did you have any other questions?
Goodbye. Please come back if you find anything interesting.
It's good to see you again.
I agree. Without the G.E.C.K., the purifier is useless to the Enclave anyway. They may give up before long.
Honestly? I don't know. I think we can scrape by, and I suppose if we can't it won't matter in the long run anyway.
